member.name: T:Mannex.StringExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for .

member.name: M:Mannex.StringExtensions.MaskEmpty(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Masks an empty string with a given mask such that the result is never an empty string. If the input string is null or empty then it is masked, otherwise the original is returned.
member.remarks: Use this method to guarantee that you never get an empty string. Bear in mind, however, that if the mask itself is an empty string then this method could yield an empty string!

member.name: M:Mannex.StringExtensions.Slice(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a section of a string from a give starting point on.
member.remarks: If is negative, it is treated as length + where length is the length of the string. If is greater or equal to the length of the string then no characters are copied to the new string.

member.name: M:Mannex.StringExtensions.Slice(System.String,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Returns a section of a string.
member.remarks: This method copies up to, but not including, the element indicated by . If is negative, it is treated as length + where length is the length of the string. If is negative, it is treated as length + where length is the length of the string. If occurs before , no characters are copied to the new string.

member.name: M:Mannex.StringExtensions.Embed(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Embeds string into , using {0} within as the point of embedding.

member.name: M:Mannex.StringExtensions.Wrap(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Wraps string between two other string where the first indicates the left side and the second indicates the right side.

member.name: M:Mannex.StringExtensions.Quote(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Enquotes string with , escaping occurences of itself with .

member.summary: Format string using as sources for replacements and a function, , that determines how to bind and resolve replacement tokens.

member.summary: Format string using as sources for replacements and a function, , that determines how to bind and resolve replacement tokens. In addition, is used for cultural formatting.

member.name: M:Mannex.StringExtensions.Split``1(System.String,System.Char,System.Func{System.String,System.String,``0})
member.summary: Splits a string into a pair using a specified character to separate the two.
member.remarks: Neither half in the resulting pair is ever null.

member.name: M:Mannex.StringExtensions.Split``1(System.String,System.Char,System.Func{System.String,System.String,System.String,``0})
member.summary: Splits a string into three parts using any of a specified set of characters to separate the three.
member.remarks: None of the resulting parts is ever null.

member.summary: Splits a string into four parts using any of a specified set of characters to separate the four.
member.remarks: None of the resulting parts is ever null.

member.summary: Collapses all sequences of white space (as deifned by Unicode and identified by ) to a single space and trims all leading and trailing white space.

member.summary: Unprotects an array of bytes containing sensitive by decrypting the data based on the user profile or machine. An additional parameter specifies the entropy to randomize the encrpytion.

member.name: T:Mannex.IO.StreamExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for .

member.name: M:Mannex.IO.StreamExtensions.Copy(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Copies one stream into another using a transfer buffer size of 4K.

member.name: M:Mannex.IO.StreamExtensions.Copy(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies one stream into another using a caller-specified transfer buffer size.

member.name: M:Mannex.IO.StreamExtensions.Copy(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Copies one stream into another using a caller-specified transfer buffer. If the buffer is null then a default one of 4K is used.

member.name: M:Mannex.IO.StreamExtensions.SaveTo(System.IO.Stream,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Copies content of the stream to fill the given buffer.

member.name: M:Mannex.IO.StreamExtensions.SaveTo(System.IO.Stream,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies content of the stream to fill the given buffer.

member.name: M:Mannex.IO.StreamExtensions.SaveToFile(System.IO.Stream,System.String)
member.summary: Saves the content of the input stream from its current position to the given file path using a default transfer buffer size of 4K.

member.name: M:Mannex.IO.StreamExtensions.SaveToFile(System.IO.Stream,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Saves the content of the input stream from its current position to the given file path using a caller-specified transfer buffer size.

member.name: M:Mannex.IO.StreamExtensions.Memorize(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Copies the content of the input stream from its current position to a memory-based stream.

member.name: M:Mannex.IO.StreamExtensions.ToArray(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Returns the remaining contents of the input as an array of unsigned bytes.

member.name: T:Mannex.IO.StringExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for .

member.name: M:Mannex.IO.StringExtensions.ToFileNameSafe(System.String)
member.summary: Makes the content of the string safe for use as a file name by replacing all invalid characters, those returned by , with an underscore.
member.remarks: This method is not guaranteed to replace the complete set of characters that are invalid in file and directory names. The full set of invalid characters can vary by file system.

member.name: M:Mannex.IO.StringExtensions.ToFileNameSafe(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Makes the content of the string safe for use as a file name by replacing all invalid characters, those returned by , with .

remarks.para: The string itself cannot carry any invalid file name characters. If is null or empty then it assumes the value of an underscore.
This method is not guaranteed to replace the complete set of characters that are invalid in file and directory names. The full set of invalid characters can vary by file system.

member.name: M:Mannex.IO.StringExtensions.ToPathNameSafe(System.String)
member.summary: Makes the content of the string safe for use as a file name by replacing all invalid characters, those returned by , with an underscore.
member.remarks: This method is not guaranteed to replace the complete set of characters that are invalid in file and directory names. The full set of invalid characters can vary by file system.

member.name: M:Mannex.IO.StringExtensions.ToPathNameSafe(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Makes the content of the string safe for use as a file name by replacing all invalid characters, those returned by , with .
member.remarks:
The string itself cannot carry any invalid file name characters. If is null or empty then it assumes the value of an underscore.
This method is not guaranteed to replace the complete set of characters that are invalid in file and directory names. The full set of invalid characters can vary by file system.

member.name: M:Mannex.Reflection.AssemblyExtensions.GetManifestResourceReader(System.Reflection.Assembly,System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Loads the specified manifest resource, scoped by the namespace of the specified type, from this assembly and returns it ready for reading as .

member.name: M:Mannex.Reflection.AssemblyExtensions.GetManifestResourceReader(System.Reflection.Assembly,System.Type,System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Loads the specified manifest resource, scoped by the namespace of the specified type, from this assembly and returns it ready for reading as . A parameter specifies the text encoding to be used for reading.

member.name: M:Mannex.Reflection.AssemblyExtensions.GetManifestResourceString(System.Reflection.Assembly,System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Loads the specified manifest resource and returns it as a string, scoped by the namespace of the specified type, from this assembly.

member.name: M:Mannex.Reflection.AssemblyExtensions.GetManifestResourceString(System.Reflection.Assembly,System.Type,System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Loads the specified manifest resource and returns it as a string, scoped by the namespace of the specified type, from this assembly. A parameter specifies the text encoding to be decode the resource bytes into text.

member.name: T:Mannex.Web.UI.DataBindingExtensions
member.summary: Provides data expression evaluation facilites similar to in ASP.NET.

member.name: M:Mannex.Web.UI.DataBindingExtensions.DataBind``1(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Evaluates data-binding expressions at run time using an expression syntax that is similar to C# and Visual Basic for accessing properties or indexing into collections.

remarks.para: This method performs late-bound evaluation, using run-time reflection and therefore can cause performance less than optimal.
In addition to , this method converts values to a null reference.

member.name: M:Mannex.Web.UI.DataBindingExtensions.DataBind(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Evaluates data-binding expressions at run time using an expression syntax that is similar to C# and Visual Basic for accessing properties or indexing into collections.

remarks.para: This method performs late-bound evaluation, using run-time reflection and therefore can cause performance less than optimal.
Unlike , this method allows to be null or an empty string and in which case it simply returns the value of .
In addition to , this method converts values to a null reference.

member.name: M:Mannex.Web.UI.DataBindingExtensions.FormatWith(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Format string using as sources for data-binding replacements.
member.remarks: This method implements most of what is described in PEP 3101 (Advanced String Formatting) from Python.

member.name: M:Mannex.Web.UI.DataBindingExtensions.FormatWith(System.String,System.IFormatProvider,System.Object[])
member.summary: Format string using as sources for data-binding replacements and for cultural formatting.
member.remarks: This method implements most of what is described in PEP 3101 (Advanced String Formatting) from Python.
